DataElement.preferredName: Painless Vital Tooth Tooth 30 Treatment Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement Next Decision Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) related to the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface involvement of the painless treatment of tooth 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system) with functioning pulpal tissue.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Painless Vital Tooth Tooth 30 Treatment Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the mesial (side of the tooth facing the midline), buccal (the surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek), pulp horn (portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp) surface involvement of the painless treatment of tooth 30 (the first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system) with functioning pulpal tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Not causing physical or psychological misery, pain or distress.:A tooth with functioning pulpal tissue.:The first, permanent six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: Not causing physical or psychological misery, pain or distress.
A tooth with functioning pulpal tissue.
The first, permanent, six-year molar of the lower right arch as defined by the Universal tooth numbering system.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredName: Mesial Surface Buccal Surface Pulp Horn Involvement
Property.preferredDefinition: That side of the tooth facing the midline.:The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.:The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: That side of the tooth facing the midline.
The surface of the tooth facing or in direct contact with the oral mucosa of the cheek.
The portion of the pulp chamber that extends towards a cusp.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of subsequent decision (the process of making a selective intellectual judgment when presented with several complex alternatives consisting of several variables, and usually defining a course of action or an idea) for treatment involvement.

PermissibleValues.value: Temporize and refer the tooth for endodontics
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Temporize and refer the tooth for endodontics
